name: excisable
content:
excisable adjective
(TAX)
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance & economics
  specialized Goods that are excisable can be taxed by the government: excisable goods The value of duties on all excisable goods has increased significantly. These products are no longer excisable.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are importing excisable goods to the country.You will need a permit for moving any excisable products from one country to another.

excisable adjective
(MEDICAL)
medical
  specialized that can be excised (= removed, especially by cutting): She is having surgery on a localized, excisable cancer. His doctors have discovered a small, excisable tumour in his brain.
More examplesFewer examplesAll the excisable tumours were removed during the procedure.
